\tThanks for downloading Utter Bull, where the object of the game is…to utter bull, and to utter it well!

You and your friends take it in turns to read out a TRUTH or a LIE about themselves.

 	Even if it's a lie, read it out as if it were true.

 	Whether it's true or not is kept secret until the very end!

Once a player reads out their statement, everyone else (individually) votes whether they think the statement is TRUE, or whether it's BULL (a lie).

 	During this decision time, the player may be interrogated by the rest of the group.

 	The voters have until the end of a time limit to finalise their vote.

If the player reads out a LIE, they will score points based on how many vote TRUE. The idea is to convince people the statement is actually the truth!


	On the other hand, if the player reads out a TRUTH, they will score points based on how many vote BULL. The idea is to appear unconvincing, so that people actually think that you're lying!


	Earn points by tricking your friends into believing the OPPOSITE of what's actually the case!

Before statements are read out by the players, they must first be written!


	Pre-game, players are assigned the role of either liar or truth-teller.


	If you're to read out a truth, you must write a truth about yourself. That's it.

If you're to read out a lie, then you must also write a lie… about SOMEONE ELSE in the group. (This person will be specified). Likewise, the lie that you read out will be written by someone else in the group. You will see it the moment your turn to read out starts.


	Of course, that means for every liar, there's a person who knows it's a lie (the person who wrote the lie). This person plays “the saboteur” during that lying player's turn. Their vote will not count in the end, but they still "pretend" vote (to blend in with the other voters).


	Like the player reading, the saboteur will score points if people vote true!

Since players write lies for other players, that lie might not turn out to be a lie - it might in fact be true for that player!


	In this case, during play phase, the player reading out the statement can simply change it to true, and play it as if it were written a truth.


	If this happens, the saboteur cannot gain points, and in fact will incur a penalty.


	The lesson here: try your best to make the lie a lie! (But it still better be believable…)

Players' scores are based on achievements earned each turn. Achievements are available based on the 3 distinct roles: player (reading out), saboteur (if there is one), and voter.


	Scores are awarded at the very end, so all player roles should be kept secret until they are revealed at the end.


	Playing as an adult group? Why not turn it into a drinking game for added hilarity? Add rules like “drink for each turn in which you scored no points” and, as the player reading out, “drink for each voter who you didn't manage to mislead”. And of course, if as saboteur your lie turned out true, you should definitely finish what you're drinking.

Finally, there are some game settings that can be tweaked by whoever is hosting the game session.


	How long a player can be interrogated for on their turn is determined by the round timer. By default this is 3 minutes, which is recommended. It can go as low as 1 minute and, if you’re really serious about this, as high as 10 minutes.


	“Liar” and “truth-teller” roles are randomly allocated, so it's possible for everyone to be a truth-teller. Some may enjoy this possibility, but others may want at least some liars in the game. You can decide to disallow the “All True” possibility with this setting. (Note: this will not prevent an “all lies turned out true” scenario)


	During the writing phase, you can get hints for inspiration if you're stuck for ideas on what to write. The final setting determines whether the content of these hints will be family-friendly, or will include risqué suggestions.

You can revisit this tutorial any time by pressing “?” on the home screen.


	Get started by going to “CREATE GAME” to create a new game session, or “JOIN GAME” to join an existing one.


	Have fun!
